Even the verdict recites that the Tuscan vessel fired two broadsides first; and so might not the Tuscan vessel be responsible for the engagement? dHe who gave the challenge to battle and to wrath is held to have begun it, and the prince from whom the malice originated is adjudged to be in fault, and, therefore, everything which may have followed is imputed to him as the aggressor.

Why, your honors, would my opponents say that it is tbe custom and sign manual of friendship to discharge a broadside once and yet again? ‘lt is the custom of a warship which is challenging a vessel, and it does so to assert its authority.
